channel.title: Hitman Blood Money and Sound Card Acceleration
channel.description: So the game crashes on the "Murder of the Crows" level. I searched and found that the solution is to disable sound card acceleration but the problem is Windows 7 doesn't have an option for it. Is there any way to, even for just when it crashes, fix the problem?

item.title: Hitman Blood Money and Sound Card Acceleration
item.dc:creator: Grief_Reaper
item.description:
Also weird fact: Hitman 2 had this option to tick a selection in the config settings of the game labled P5, looked it up and you controlled the game with this:

https://www.vrealities.com/P5.html

Read full topic

item.title: Hitman Blood Money and Sound Card Acceleration
item.dc:creator: Kairouseki
item.description:
Do these to the actual game exe or make a shortcut with Steam and do it to those?

Edit: Doing either to the actual exe won’t allow it to start.

Edit 2: I validated the game files and it said that 3 failed to validate. Will try again once these are downloaded.

Final Edit: Okay, that seemed to have worked. I guess that should be my first step whenever something like this happens .

Read full topic
item.source: Hitman Blood Money and Sound Card Acceleration

item.title: Hitman Blood Money and Sound Card Acceleration
item.dc:creator: russilker
item.description:
The problem isn’t with sound card acceleration. The reason you can’t control it in Windows 7 is because Microsoft removed the hardware acceleration entirely, so that isn’t the cause of your issues.

Have you tried the simple things, like running the game in compatibility mode, right-clicking on the icon and running it as Admin, etc?

Read full topic
item.source: Hitman Blood Money and Sound Card Acceleration

item.title: Hitman Blood Money and Sound Card Acceleration
item.dc:creator: Kairouseki
item.description:
Okay, I disabled my sound card and played it again but it still crashed. My video card sound (it says ATI Sound) is still on, though. Do I have to disable both of them?

Read full topic
